metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the cropland eddy covariance system (EC) in the lower reaches of the Heihe hydrometeorological observation network from 14 July to 11 December, 2013. The site (101.134° E, 42.005° N) was located in the muskmelon surface, Ejin Banner in Inner Mongolia. The elevation is 875 m. The EC was installed at a height of 3.5 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&EC150) was 0 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), as proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), which represent high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened using a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.2 m/s. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. Due to the CF card storage problem and calibration of CO2/H2O gas analyzer, data during 29 July to 19 August and 11 December to 31 December were missing.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. 
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), Liu et al. (2011) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2013年7月14日至2013年12月11日的黑河水文气象观测网下游农田站的涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗四道桥，下垫面是甜瓜。观测点的经纬度是101.1338E, 42.0048N，海拔875m。涡动相关仪的架高3.5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是0cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。其中7月29日-8月9日采集器存储出现问题，12月11日-12月31日CO2/H2O分析仪标定，期间数据缺失。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型包含所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改进了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量来更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误造成的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'TSEB model' refer to in the context of evapotranspiration estimation?
Definition.QuestionCn: 'TSEB模型'在蒸散发估算的上下文中指的是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'TSEB model' refers to the Two-Source Energy Balance model, which is used to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration for land covered with vegetation. It separates the land surface into soil and vegetation components, each with distinct temperatures and resistance, improving the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates over heterogeneous landscapes compared to one-source models.
Definition.AnswerCn: 'TSEB模型'指的是双源能量平衡模型，用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。它将地表分为土壤和植被两个组成部分，每个部分具有不同的温度和阻力，相比于单源模型，它在异质景观中提高了蒸散估算的准确性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods using eddy covariance systems compare between oasis–desert ecosystems and irrigated agricultural areas in terms of handling energy flux measurements?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用涡度协方差系统的数据收集方法在绿洲-沙漠生态系统和灌溉农业区域之间在处理能量通量测量方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In oasis–desert ecosystems, the eddy covariance system is used to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, complemented by data from scintillometers and automatic weather stations, focusing on long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. In contrast, in irrigated agricultural areas, the eddy covariance system is used to measure turbulent fluxes at a sampling frequency of 10 Hz, with a focus on evaluating the TSEB model for latent heat flux estimations, particularly under strong advective conditions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲–沙漠生态系统中，涡动协方差系统用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，辅以来自闪烁仪和自动气象站的数据，重点关注能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期观测。相比之下，在灌溉农业区域，涡动协方差系统以10 Hz的采样频率测量湍流通量，重点评估TSEB模型在强平流条件下的潜热通量估算。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions compare when using the TSEB model versus traditional methods?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用TSEB模型与传统方法估算蒸散发的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The TSEB model faces challenges such as uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences and classification errors in thermal images, which impact the accuracy of soil and canopy temperature estimations. Traditional methods, such as those relying on eddy covariance systems, face challenges with energy balance closures and the complexity of accurately calculating resistances in heterogeneous landscapes. Both methods require careful consideration of environmental conditions and data quality to ensure reliable estimations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: TSEB模型面临着表面-空气温差的不确定性和热图像分类错误等挑战，这影响了土壤和冠层温度估计的准确性。传统方法，如依赖涡度协方差系统的方法，面临着能量平衡闭合的挑战，以及在异质景观中准确计算阻力的复杂性。这两种方法都需要仔细考虑环境条件和数据质量，以确保可靠的估计。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What factors might influence the quality and reliability of flux measurements in oasis–desert systems using eddy covariance and scintillometer methods?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在使用涡度协方差和闪烁仪方法对绿洲-沙漠系统进行通量测量时，可能影响测量质量和可靠性的因素有哪些？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Factors influencing the quality and reliability of flux measurements in oasis–desert systems using eddy covariance and scintillometer methods include image classification errors that affect component temperature accuracy, the uncertainty of the EC system especially in small mean H conditions, and errors in estimating incoming radiation transmittances. Additionally, environmental challenges such as strong advection can affect the measurement outcomes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 影响绿洲-沙漠系统中使用涡度协方差和闪烁仪方法进行通量测量质量和可靠性的因素包括影响组分温度准确性的图像分类错误、尤其在小平均热量条件下涡度协方差系统的不确定性，以及估计入射辐射透过率的误差。此外，强烈的平流等环境挑战也会影响测量结果。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the application of thermal infrared cameras enhance the accuracy of soil and canopy temperature measurements in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 热红外相机的应用如何提高异质景观中土壤和冠层温度测量的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Thermal infrared cameras can enhance the accuracy of soil and canopy temperature measurements by providing high-resolution thermal images. These images allow for precise separation of soil and canopy temperatures, which helps improve the estimation of surface fluxes, especially in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas. The accurate component temperature calculation is crucial for reliable estimations of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration ratios.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 热红外相机通过提供高分辨率的热成像，可以提高土壤和冠层温度测量的准确性。这些图像允许精确区分土壤和冠层温度，从而有助于改善表面通量的估算，特别是在强烈的对流灌溉农业区域。准确的成分温度计算对于可靠估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散比率至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes contribute to sustainable development in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观察能量、水蒸气和碳通量可以通过以下方式促进干旱地区的可持续发展：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes can contribute to sustainable development in arid regions by providing essential data for understanding oasis–desert interactions. This data is crucial for maintaining ecological stability, achieving carbon neutrality, and supporting socioeconomic development. It helps in recognizing the balance between oasis and desert systems, which is significant for ecological security and sustainable development.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期观察能量、水汽和碳通量可以通过提供理解绿洲与沙漠相互作用的基本数据，促进干旱地区的可持续发展。这些数据对于维持生态稳定、实现碳中和和支持社会经济发展至关重要。它有助于识别绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡，这对生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in obtaining accurate measurements of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中，获取能量、水汽和碳通量的准确测量面临哪些挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological environment degradation such as drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in many inland river basins.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态环境恶化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，尤其是在许多内陆河流流域。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why might the TSEB model face difficulties in accurately estimating surface fluxes in irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: TSEB模型在准确估计灌溉农业区域的表面通量时可能面临困难的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The TSEB model faces difficulties due to the strong advective environment, which affects the surface-air temperature difference and leads to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the radiometric temperature.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: TSEB模型由于强烈的平流环境而面临困难，这影响了地表与空气温度的差异，并导致从辐射温度中确定地表土壤和植被组分温度时出现错误。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes uncertainties in the estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures using remote sensing techniques?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用遥感技术估计土壤和冠层成分温度的不确定性原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Uncertainties arise from image classification errors, particularly in areas with varying vegetation abundance, and the neglect of atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, which affect the accuracy of the component temperature estimations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 不确定性源于图像分类错误，特别是在植被丰度变化的区域，以及忽视大气上行辐射和透射率，这影响了成分温度估计的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential impacts of utilizing high-frequency eddy covariance data on the estimation of evapotranspiration and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用高频涡度协方差数据对绿洲-沙漠生态系统的蒸散发和碳通量估算的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of high-frequency eddy covariance data can lead to improved estimation of evapotranspiration and carbon fluxes by providing more precise measurements of turbulent fluxes and atmospheric conditions. This enhances the accuracy of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange calculations, which are crucial for understanding the ecological interactions in oasis-desert ecosystems. It also allows for better validation and refinement of models like the TSEB model, particularly in heterogeneous and advective environments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 高频涡度协方差数据的使用可以提高蒸散发和碳通量的估算，通过提供更精确的湍流通量和大气条件的测量。这增强了能量、水蒸气和碳交换计算的准确性，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的生态相互作用至关重要。它还允许更好地验证和完善像TSEB模型这样的模型，特别是在异质和对流环境中。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What consequences might arise from long-term data collection in oasis-desert areas on understanding the energy and carbon exchanges in these ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区进行长期数据收集可能会对理解这些生态系统中的能量和碳交换产生哪些后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term data collection in oasis-desert areas can significantly improve understanding of energy and carbon exchanges by providing comprehensive datasets that capture temporal variability and trends over time. This aids in assessing the ecological stability and sustainability of these systems and supports the development of strategies for carbon neutrality. It also facilitates the recognition of oasis-desert interactions and their impact on the global carbon cycle.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区进行长期数据收集可以显著提高对能量和碳交换的理解，因为它提供了捕捉时间变化和趋势的综合数据集。这有助于评估这些系统的生态稳定性和可持续性，并支持制定碳中和的策略。它还促进了对绿洲-沙漠相互作用及其对全球碳循环影响的认识。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives of employing the eddy covariance system for data collection in the context of oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，采用涡度协方差系统进行数据收集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include quantitatively understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. This understanding is significant for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, as well as ensuring sustainable oasis development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。这种理解对实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标，以及确保可持续的绿洲发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use high-resolution thermal cameras to estimate soil and canopy component temperatures in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在农业区域中，使用高分辨率热像仪来估计土壤和冠层成分温度的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: High-resolution thermal cameras are important for accurately estimating soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for estimating evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. This approach aims to provide reliable estimates of energy fluxes in strongly advection-irrigated agricultural areas, which are challenging due to the heterogeneity of soil and vegetation temperatures.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪对于准确估计土壤和冠层组分温度至关重要，这对于使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型估计蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET）是必不可少的。这种方法旨在为强烈的平流灌溉农业区域提供可靠的能量通量估计，这些区域由于土壤和植被温度的异质性而具有挑战性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of maintaining long-term flux and auxiliary data observations in artificial and natural oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统中，维护长期通量和辅助数据观测的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals include understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which are essential for achieving sustainable oasis development. Long-term observations aid in recognizing interactions within the oasis–desert systems, contributing to the ecological security and sustainable development of these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的基本特征，这对于实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。长期观察有助于识别绿洲-沙漠系统内的相互作用，从而促进这些地区的生态安全和可持续发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can the accuracy of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux measurements be improved in oasis–desert ecosystems using various data collection methods?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何通过各种数据收集方法提高绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳通量测量的准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Improving accuracy can involve using a combination of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, as well as integrating hydrometeorological data from automatic weather stations. The inclusion of vegetation and soil parameters can further enhance data quality. Data processing and quality control procedures, such as data collection, processing, and archiving, are critical for ensuring reliable measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 提高准确性可以涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪组合获取湍流通量数据，以及整合自动气象站的水文气象数据。纳入植被和土壤参数可以进一步提升数据质量。数据处理和质量控制程序，如数据收集、处理和归档，对于确保可靠的测量至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are necessary for processing eddy covariance data to ensure reliable estimation of evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 处理涡度协方差数据以确保在农业地区可靠估算蒸散发所需的程序步骤有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Processing eddy covariance data involves several steps such as removing erroneous data, correcting delay times, rotating coordinates, applying frequency response corrections, and correcting for ultrasonic temperature and density (WPL) issues. Data must also be quality-checked for atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity tests. Further filtering includes removing data affected by instrument errors, precipitation, and weak nighttime turbulence.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 处理涡度协方差数据涉及多个步骤，例如去除错误数据、校正延迟时间、旋转坐标、应用频率响应校正，以及纠正超声波温度和密度（WPL）问题。数据还必须进行质量检查，以确保大气稳定性和湍流相似性测试。进一步的过滤包括去除受仪器错误、降水和弱夜间湍流影响的数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods are essential to accurately measure energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，准确测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换的必要数据收集方法有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: In oasis–desert systems, data collection involves using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers to acquire turbulent flux data, while automatic weather stations gather hydrometeorological data such as radiation, soil heat flux, air temperature gradients, humidity, wind speed, and groundwater table data. These observations provide a comprehensive suite of datasets crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在绿洲–沙漠系统中，数据收集涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，同时自动气象站收集辐射、土壤热通量、空气温度梯度、湿度、风速和地下水位等水文气象数据。这些观测提供了一套全面的数据集，对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges must be addressed to improve the accuracy of surface flux measurements in strongly advective environments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在强对流环境中，提高表面通量测量准确性必须解决哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: In strongly advective environments, challenges such as incomplete energy balance closure, errors in surface-air temperature difference determination, and uncertainties in component temperature estimation due to image classification errors must be addressed. Improving the separation of soil and vegetation temperatures and accounting for atmospheric conditions can enhance the accuracy of surface flux measurements.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在强对流环境中，面临着诸如能量平衡闭合不完全、表面与空气温度差确定中的误差以及由于图像分类错误导致的组分温度估计不确定性等挑战。改善土壤和植被温度的分离，并考虑大气条件，可以提高表面通量测量的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be challenging to obtain accurate surface flux measurements in an oasis–desert system using traditional data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，使用传统数据收集方法获取准确的表面通量测量可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In an oasis–desert system, the challenges arise from factors such as the heterogeneous landscape and the complex interactions between soil and vegetation, which can affect energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. Additionally, arid and semiarid regions face environmental degradation challenges, such as drying rivers and lakes, which can further complicate accurate flux measurements.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，挑战来自于异质的景观以及土壤与植被之间复杂的相互作用，这些因素会影响能量、水汽和碳的交换。此外，干旱和半干旱地区面临环境退化的挑战，例如河流和湖泊干涸，这进一步使得准确的通量测量变得复杂。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might traditional composite temperature separation approaches be less effective in arid regions for measuring E and T?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 传统的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区测量蒸散发（E）和温度（T）时可能效果较差的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Traditional composite temperature separation approaches may be less effective in arid regions due to the prevalent advective conditions, classification errors in vegetation abundance, and uncertainties in estimating incoming radiation transmittances. These factors can lead to errors in estimated soil and canopy component temperatures, ultimately affecting the measurement of E and T.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 传统的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区可能效果较差，原因包括普遍存在的平流条件、植被丰度分类错误以及估算入射辐射透过率的不确定性。这些因素可能导致土壤和冠层成分温度的估算错误，最终影响蒸散（E）和温度（T）的测量。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you perceive the challenges of accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, particularly when considering the completeness of energy balance closure?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何看待在强对流灌溉农业区域准确估计表面通量的挑战，特别是在考虑能量平衡闭合的完整性时？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to available energy. The uncertainty in surface-air temperature difference and errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures significantly affect model performance. These challenges highlight the need for precise measurement techniques and model adaptations to improve estimation accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为可用能量与能量平衡的闭合度不完整。表面与空气温度差的误差以及确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的错误对模型性能有显著影响。这些挑战突显了需要精确测量技术和模型调整，以提高估计的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why it is challenging to accurately estimate surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么在强对流的灌溉农业地区准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging because the eddy covariance (EC) flux measurements of sensible and latent heat often have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy. Additionally, uncertainties in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the composite radiometric temperature can affect the model performance.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，因为涡度协方差（EC）对显热和潜热的通量测量通常与可用能量之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的问题。此外，从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度的不确定性也会影响模型的性能。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the limitations of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对干旱地区复合温度分离方法的局限性感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Composite temperature separation approaches are limited in arid regions because errors in the derived component temperature often result from image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. These errors can lead to an overestimation of canopy temperature and uncertainties in the estimated incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 复合温度分离方法在干旱地区受到限制，因为衍生的组成温度中的错误往往源于图像分类错误，而这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些错误可能导致对冠层温度的过高估计，并对通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透过率的估计产生不确定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide an analysis of the data collection methods used for monitoring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供对用于监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的数据收集方法的分析。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in oasis-desert ecosystems involve long-term monitoring using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data. Additionally, automatic weather stations provide hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. These methods are supplemented with groundwater table data, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行长期监测，以获取半小时的湍流通量数据。此外，自动气象站提供水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。这些方法还补充了地下水位数据、植被和土壤参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please evaluate the challenges associated with accurately estimating evapotranspiration components in a heterogeneous landscape using the TSEB model.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 评估在异质景观中使用TSEB模型准确估计蒸散发组成部分所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges with using the TSEB model in a heterogeneous landscape include the complexity of the model, which has over five resistances that are difficult to calculate accurately. The model's reliance on parameters and observations that are not readily obtainable from operational satellite and ground-based data further limits its applicability. Errors in estimating surface fluxes are primarily due to the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences and image classification errors, which affect the separation of soil and canopy component temperatures.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中使用TSEB模型面临的挑战包括模型的复杂性，该模型具有超过五个难以准确计算的阻力。模型对参数和观测的依赖性限制了其适用性，这些参数和观测并不容易从操作卫星和地面数据中获得。估计表面通量的误差主要源于表面与空气温度差异的不确定性以及图像分类错误，这影响了土壤和冠层组件温度的分离。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline potential strategies for enhancing the quality of datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid and semiarid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 概述提高干旱和半干旱地区与能源、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集质量的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Enhancing dataset quality in these regions could involve improving image classification techniques to reduce errors in component temperature separation, ensuring accurate calculation of soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures, and better accounting for atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance. Long-term observation data from multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations can be integrated to provide comprehensive datasets. Additionally, validating model outputs against ground-based measurements and incorporating advanced remote sensing technologies may help improve data accuracy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在这些地区，提高数据集质量可能涉及改进图像分类技术，以减少组件温度分离中的错误，确保准确计算土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度，并更好地考虑大气上行辐射和透射率。可以整合来自多个地表通量和气象站的长期观测数据，以提供综合数据集。此外，将模型输出与地面测量结果进行验证，并结合先进的遥感技术，可能有助于提高数据的准确性。
